result.execSummary:
The defendant John Harry Shomo Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution hearing held 12/4/2014.  The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court waives $250 DNA Surcharge.
Court orders court costs to be paid during term of supervision.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant John Harry Shomo in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Olmr confirms defendant wishes to appear by video conference. Court questions defendant who states he wishes to appear by video conference for this hearing. Atty. Perry Lieuallen appears for victim. Another victim is out of town and Court will adjourn restitution hearing as to that victim. Officer Eric Ramthun sworn and testified. K.V. sworn and testified. 
J. T. sworn and testified. John Shomo sworn and testified. Court renders decision on restitution finding amount $3713.57 is due to J.T. and $100 for motorcyle helmet to K.V. and the $500 deductable. Court will schedule another restitution with regard to L. P., State will advise clerk when victim is available.

Sentencing hearing on October 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John Harry Shomo in court with attorney Robert P Olmr.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Court examines defendant and finds defendant guilty. On motion of the State, Court orders Ct. 2 & 3 dismissed and readin. State will be recommending 9 years prison with 4 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision consecutive. Counsel will attempt to resolve the restitution issue before sentencing.
